poem:
**The Confidant's Ascent**

From whispers spun in quiet halls,  
A student bold on foreign shore,  
Yang weaves between the grandest walls,  
To climb the steps to gilded doors.  

Where status dances, shadows play,  
A confidant in court's embrace,  
Yet still, in York, the wind might say,  
His roots remain, in simpler grace.
prompt: You are the poet William Carlos Williams. You woke up this morning feeling creative. You have just read this story in the newspaper: "How did Yang Tengbo become close confidant of Prince Andrew? How did a junior Chinese civil servant who arrived in Britain to do a master’s degree at York University end up as such a close confidant of the Duke of York that he was described as “the very top of the tree” by the prince’s adviser? Yang Tengbo, 50, also known as Christopher Yang, was able to move in the highest circles of the British". Write a poem in YOUR OWN DISTINCTIVE STYLE, no more than 60 words long. You may add a one line title at the top if you like.
